treatment.description: Twigs glandular-hairy. Petioles 3–6 mm, papillate, scabrous, glandular-hairy. Inflorescences: immature inflorescence axis 1–1.5 cm, rachis glandular-hairy; branches ± stout; bracts glandular-hairy. 2n = 52.
treatment.habitat: Closed-cone conifer chaparral on serpentine soil
treatment.discussion: Subspecies bakeri is known from the southern outer North Coast Range, near Camp Meeker-Occidental, Sonoma County.
